graphicslib3D

Class Point3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Point3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Point3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Defines a three-dimensional homogeneous point. Each Point3D object contains four components: X, Y, and Z, the 3-dimensional coordinates of the point, and W, the homogeneous component.
    Version:
    4.10 02/19/05
    Author:
    William Dimaculangan, Monika Jankun-Kelly, John Clevenger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Point3D()
      Creates a new Point3D with defaults of X,Y,Z = 0.0 and W = 1.0.
      Point3D(double[] values)
      Creates a new Point3D whose values are taken from the specified array of doubles.
      Point3D(double X, double Y, double Z)
      Creates a new Point3D given three coordinates.
      Point3D(double X, double Y, double Z, double W)
      Creates a new Point3D given three coordinates and a W value.
      Point3D(float[] values)
      Creates a new Point3D whose values are taken from the specified array of floats.
      Point3D(Vector3D vec)
      Constructs a new Point3D implied by the specified Vector3D; that is, considers the specified Vector3D as a vector from the origin to the point specified by the head of the vector, and constructs a Point3D containing the same X,Y,Z values as the Vector3D.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Point3D

        public Point3D()
        Creates a new Point3D with defaults of X,Y,Z = 0.0 and W = 1.0.

      • Point3D

        public Point3D(double X,
               double Y,
               double Z)
        Creates a new Point3D given three coordinates. The default value for W is 1.0.

      • Point3D

        public Point3D(double X,
               double Y,
               double Z,
               double W)
        Creates a new Point3D given three coordinates and a W value.

      • Point3D

        public Point3D(float[] values)
        Creates a new Point3D whose values are taken from the specified array of floats. If the array length is 3, the values are assumed to represent X, Y, and Z and a default value of W=1.0 is assigned. If the array length is 4 or more, the first four values are used for X, Y, Z, and W and any additional values are silently ignored. If the array length is less than 3 an exception is thrown.

      • Point3D

        public Point3D(double[] values)
        Creates a new Point3D whose values are taken from the specified array of doubles. If the array length is 3, the values are assumed to represent X, Y, and Z and a default value of W=1.0 is assigned. If the array length is 4 or more, the first four values are used for X, Y, Z, and W and any additional values are silently ignored. If the array length is less than 3 an exception is thrown.

      • Point3D

        public Point3D(Vector3D vec)
        Constructs a new Point3D implied by the specified Vector3D; that is, considers the specified Vector3D as a vector from the origin to the point specified by the head of the vector, and constructs a Point3D containing the same X,Y,Z values as the Vector3D. The W component of the new Point3D is set to 1, regardless of the value in the W component of the vector (which is normally 0).
        Parameters:
        vec -

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the X component of this Point3D object.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the Y component of this Point3D object.

      • getZ

        public double getZ()
        Returns the Z component of this Point3D object.

      • getW

        public double getW()
        Returns the W component of this Point3D object. W is is another name for the homogeneous component.

      • setX

        public void setX(double newX)
        Sets the X component of this Point3D object.

      • setY

        public void setY(double newY)
        Sets the Y component of this Point3D object.

      • setZ

        public void setZ(double newZ)
        Sets the Z component of this Point3D object.

      • setW

        public void setW(double newW)
        Sets the W component of this Point3D object.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a new Point3D which is a deep clone of this Point3D.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • minus

        public Point3D minus(Point3D p2)
        Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the difference between this point's X,Y,Z and the specified point's X,Y,Z. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

      • distanceTo

        public double distanceTo(Point3D p2)
        Returns a real number that is the distance between this point and the specified point.

      • add

        public Point3D add(Point3D p2)
        Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the sum of this point's values and the specified point's values. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

      • mid

        public Point3D mid(Point3D p2)
        Returns a new Point3D which is the midpoint between this point and the specified point. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

      • mult

        public Point3D mult(double theMultiplier)
        Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this point by the given multiplier. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

      • div

        public Point3D div(double theDivisor)
        Returns a new Point3D which is the result of dividing this point by the given divisor. The new Point3D's W value is the default (1.0).

      • mult

        public Point3D mult(Matrix3D mat)
        Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this point by the given matrix. Multiplication is done "from the right". That is, this method returns a new point P' such that P' = [givenMatrix] x [thisPoint].

      • scale

        public void scale(double scaleFactor)
        Scales each of the X, Y, and Z components of this point by the given scaleFactor. Note that unlike most Point3D methods, this method does NOT return a new Point3D; it scales THIS point. The W value in the point is unchanged.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Point3D other)
        Returns true if all four elements of this Point3D are equal to the corresponding elements of the specified Point3D; false if one or more elements are not the same.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a printable representation of this Point3D.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
